meanings.definition: A small strip or cube of pork fat used in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The chef added a crispy lardon to the salad for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the salty taste of a lardon in my pasta dishes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a lardon from the kitchen and ran up a tree.
meanings.sent4: The golden lardon sizzled in the pan, releasing its savory aroma.
meanings.sent5: The lardon melted into the dish, infusing it with rich pork flavor.

meanings.definition: To garnish or flavor with lardons.
meanings.sent1: She decided to lardon the soup with small pieces of bacon for added taste.
meanings.sent2: The chef will lardon the quiche with bits of ham before baking.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally lardoned his coffee with sugar instead of salt.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly lardoned vegetables filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully lardoned the dish, enhancing its deliciousness.
